blocks.text: Control types describe what a control is intended to accomplish relative to an event or attack.

items: Preventive control: stops an event before it happens (blocks access or exploitation).
Deterrent control: discourages action by increasing perceived risk or consequences (e.g., login banner, warning signs).
Detective control: discovers or alerts on activity (alerts, monitoring, log review).
Corrective control: restores service or reduces impact after detection (restore from backup, re-image systems).
Compensating control: alternative/temporary measure when the primary control isnâ€™t available (segmentation rule while waiting for a patch).
Directive control: directs behavior toward safer actions (training, procedures, signs).

blocks.text: Example: A firewall rule is a preventive control (type) implemented as a technical control (category).
